material-property-value-condition.content:
Please analyze the following paragraph and summarize the properties, including their numerical values, of the mentioned materials.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Material Name', 'Material Property', 'Material Property (Abbr.)', 'Numerical Value', 'Condition']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It was also found that the blend films of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT with PC71BM showed surface roughness with rootmean - square ( rms ) of 4.0 , 2.6 , and 0.4 nm , respectively. As film morphology plays a critical role in charge transport , the smoother blend film based on PIDT-C12NT that present more favorable morphological features , may effectively reduce charge recombination and traps , and thereby potentially lead to higher J sc and fill factor ( FF ) than the other two polymers. Photovoltaic Properties. The photovoltaic properties of the resulting polymers were investigated with a conventional device structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS ( 40 nm ) / polym e r : P C 7^1 B M ( 8^0 n m ) / p o l y [ ( 9 , 9 -b i s ( 3 â€² -( N , Ndimethylamino)propyl)-2,7-fluorene)-alt-2,7-(9,9-dioctylfluorene) ] ( PFN ) ( 5 nm ) / Al ( 100 nm ) , here a thin layer of PFN was employed as the cathode interlayer since it can improve the electron extraction. 56-58 We chose PC71BM as the acceptor because it had much stronger absorption in the visible region than PC61BM , which can complement the absorption valley of the polymers and beneficial for high - efficiency PSCs. 59 The BHJ photoactive layer was prepared by spin - coating chlorobenzene solution of the polymer : PC71BM with weight ratio of 1 : 2 on the top of PEDOT : PSS layer without further treatment. The tests were performed under the illumination of AM 1.5G , 100 mW cm^-2 with an active of area of 0.16 cm^2. The J-V characteristics are shown in Figure 6a and the parameters of J sc , V oc , FF and PCE of the resulting PSCs are summarized in Table 2. It was found that all PSC devices based on these polymers demonstrated relative high V oc of ca. 0.8 - 0.9 V , which benefited from the deep HOMO levels. Device based on PIDT - EHNT obtained a low PCE of 1.49% , with a J sc of 4.33 mA cm^-2 , a V oc of 0.86 V and a FF of 40% . Slightly improved device performance was realized based on PIDT - DTNT , which exhibited a V oc of 0.80 V , a FF of 45% , but a dramatically improved J sc of 8.26 mA cm^-2 , leading to a moderate PCE of 2.97% . Best device performance with a PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT , which showed further improved J sc of 10.21 mA cm^-2 , a V oc of 0.90 V and a FF of 55% .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name | Material Property | Material Property (Abbr.) | Numerical Value | Condition |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| PIDT - EHNT / PIDT - DTNT / PIDT-C12NT with PC71BM | Surface Roughness | rms | 4.0 nm / 2.6 nm / 0.4 nm | - |
| PIDT - EHNT | HOMO Level | - | Deep | - |
| PIDT - EHNT | Jsc | J sc | 4.33 mA cm^-2 | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT - EHNT | Voc | V oc | 0.86 V | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT - EHNT | FF | FF | 40% | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT - EHNT | PCE | PCE | 1.49% | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT - DTNT | HOMO Level | - | Deep | - |
| PIDT - DTNT | Jsc | J sc | 8.26 mA cm^-2 | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT - DTNT | Voc | V oc | 0.80 V | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT - DTNT | FF | FF | 45% | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT - DTNT | PCE | PCE | 2.97% | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT-C12NT | HOMO Level | - | Deep | - |
| PIDT-C12NT | Jsc | J sc | 10.21 mA cm^-2 | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT-C12NT | Voc | V oc | 0.90 V | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT-C12NT | FF | FF | 55% | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |
| PIDT-C12NT | PCE | PCE | 5.05% | AM 1.5G, 100 mW cm^-2, active area of 0.16 cm^2 |

The table above summarizes the properties of the materials mentioned in the paragraph. The materials PIDT - EHNT, PIDT - DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT are blended with PC71BM and have surface roughness (rms) values of 4.0 nm, 2.6 nm, and 0.4 nm, respectively. The HOMO levels of these materials are deep, and they are used in polymer solar cells (PSCs) with a conventional device structure. The Jsc, Voc, FF, and PCE of the PSC devices based on these polymers are also presented in the table. The device based on PIDT - EHNT has a low PCE of 1.49%, while the device based on PIDT-C12NT has the best device performance with a PCE of 5.05%.
